Hi Nile!

A few suggestions on future videos:
****Medicine
- Synthesis of adrenaline/noradrenaline
- Synthesis of local anaesthetics e.g Lidocaine, Bupivacaine etc.
- Synthesis of a few antibiotics eg. sulfonamides
- Synthesis of hypnotics e.g. propofol, thiopental
- Synthesis of antiseptics e.g. chlorhexidine, benzalkonium chloride
- Synthesis of hydrogen peroxide, potassium permanganate, sodiumhypochlorite
****Polymeres and special carbon modifications
- Synthesis of kevlar
- Synthesis of common fibers polyamides, polyesters, ...
- Making of fullerenes, carbon nanotubes, graphene
****Light and Color
- Synthesis of liquid crystals
- Synthesis of phtalic acid (for Luminol) from naphtalene (mothballs)
- Organic color photovoltaic cells (Graetzel-cells)
- Quantum dot chemistry
- Artist´s colors
- Photography and development
****Fire and Electrical Energy
- fuel cells (methanol, formic acid...)
- different sorts of batteries (NiMH, lead-acid, Zn-carbon, ...)
- different chemical approaches of making fire
- matchsticks, barbecue starter, firing gel...
- flash mixtures, smoke mixtures
- ferrocerium rods, pyrophoric iron
****leisure time approaches
- Chemical garden
- crystal growing
****metals
- Liquid metal alloys (Rose metal etc.)
- Bronze, brass, ...
- Memory alloys
- Rheological fluids
- Mineral and ore harvesting: processing, extraction...
****acids and bases, oxidizers and deoxidizers
- making of sulfuric acid, hydrochloric acid, nitrous acid, acetic acid...different approches including electrochemistry
- different pH-marker-solutions
- Redox-reactions
****Working as a chemist
- Waste treatment and recycling (heavy metals, ...)
- Basic labware introduction
- Basic procedures introduction (distillation, crystallization, cleaning, separation...)
- Analytical chemistry: identification of different metalions, nitrates etc. in solutions
- Basic safety advices
- Basic approaches on how to synthesize a given structure based on a formula

I was generating chlorine to sterilize the inside of my gf's car from bedbugs and a moldy smell in the ac, and inadvertently picked up the two types of chlorine tabs. Either one plus acid would have been fine, as would have been 10% bleach + acid, but the two together started making a strange bubble mess in a medium sized tupperware, i had pushed it to the side so it could boil over in the street and once the bubbles got big enough everything went FPS game quiet. Didn't seem like a fire explosion just a tremendous amount of gas and pressure. I'm no stranger to explosions being former army as well but this really caught me off guard, I haven't been able to find exactly what was made, and i'm in between chem courses so haven't had time to ask a prof. Thanks in advance.

Maybe you could do the synthesis of a thiol like pentyl or hexyl mercaptane from the corresponding alkyl halide (you made some bromopentane using PBr3 so this could be used) and thiourea. This reaction yields an intermediate that can be cleaved with NaOH to give the thiol and "normal" urea.
Also, this procedure can be used to make thioethers! ;)

Nile Red, I'm not sure if you know this, but many amateur scientists would love to get their hands on some (conc) nitric acid. Not literally of course! I not sure about Canada, but in the U.S. it is really hard for most to come by concentrated nitric acid without paying huge shipping fees.

I know you already have a video on fuming nitric acid, and it is great. But for obtaining nitric acid it doesn't give a very good yield for all the materials you use. Also, I'm not too hot about handling that stuff without gloves...from what I have read it seems pretty viscious.

I would greatly appreciate it if you could upload a video that produces more nitric acid at a safer concentration, like 40-70%.

Thank you very much!

First of all, let me say that I absolutely love your channel and I'm glad great synthesis videos are being uploaded to YouTube on a regular basis again.

As someone who did a lot of organometallic work in grad school, I have been really intrigued by the possibilities of amateur chemistry ever since I saw a post by a sciencemadness user where they did a large-scale synthesis of nickelocene in their home lab. Would you be interested in trying to make ferrocene? Unlike Cp2Ni, Cp2Fe is stable indefinitely under normal storage conditions and is not a synthetic dead-end. It has applications ranging from non-aqueous electrochem to aromatic substitution reactions.

Hi Nile.
Something I would love to see is synthesis of Pyridine by decarboxylation of Niacin.  It seems like a great synthesis but I don't have the equipment to do it.  Here is a thread on Science Madness detailing the synth. https://www.sciencemadness.org/whisper/viewthread.php?tid=13130

By the way, I love you videos!
Thanks so much.

PLS. I have requiest for interesting video. Exactly if it possible to produce in efficient way HNO3 by electrolysis of NH4NO3, or maybe other nitrate salt? I am student of high school and hadn't got time to finish my experiment(Holidays ended and out of home), that was connected with new method of synthesis HNO3 by electrolysis of NH4NO3- method for amateurs :).  I will describe what i could find out by experiment i've done:
Components:
NH4NO3, 2 bakers, some cottons(2- i've used round cosmetics), water, power supply, graphit rods for electrods( i am useing graphite from penciles for artists- made fully of graphite, good source)
Experiment was like:
2 bakers were filled at maximum with quiet strong sollution of NH4NO3 in water. They were touching tchem selfs/were next to each other clously and connected by 2 cotton swabs(soaked by sollution too), by putting tchem into botch sollutions in bakers just too make bridge that will conduct elecricity, and won't allow to mix sollutions  in both bakers( this experiment didnt worked when were simple electrolysis in one baker). In both sollutions in bakers were graphite rods connected to car baterry suplly, with parameters just to make it work and not making rods to be destroyed too fast(My measurer were broken). I let the experiment to go for few hours and get sollutions that one was strongly smelly with NH3 and other that was strongly acidly  :)  What happend, reaction , is quiet obvious i think. Unfortunetly i havent got time to find out any more about reaction i've done. I would like very much to ask you to made this experiment in more professional way to calculated if it is cost-effective method of producing HNO3 for amateur( I mean maybe more details about it and maybe distilation of acid sollution to get idea how much acid we get by electrolysis, or if it is at all HNO3 :) If it works well it could be great way to make HNO3 and H2SO4 from HNO3, cose they are quietly difficulty available in Europe :(
